full_summary:
# Tender Announcement: Commissioning Consultant

## Important Information

* Tender Title: Commissioning Consultant
* Reference Number: PW-_PPS-002-28768 (Amendment 2)
* Solicitation Number: EP938-230112/A
* Tender Status: Expired
* Closing Date: 23 September 2022, 14:00 EDT

## Table of Contents

* Program Description
* Requirements
* Evaluation Criteria
* Security Requirements
* Bid Documents
* Debriefing

## Program Description

The Science and Parliamentary Infrastructure Branch of Public Works and Government Services Canada requires a Commissioning (Cx) Consultant to provide Existing Building Commissioning (EBCx) services and project management support services for new construction in response to various government programs and initiatives.

## Requirements

The Commissioning Consultant will be responsible for:

* Identifying operational and maintenance enhancements to improve energy efficiency, occupant comfort, and indoor air quality
* Documenting baseline operating conditions through trending of performance measurements
* Establishing Carbon Footprint before and after implementation of Energy Conservation Measures (ECM)
* Optimize control systems through calibration of critical sensors, review metered data, and trend logs
* Identifying O&M staff training needs
* Enhancing documentation of the O&M requirements for the equipment and systems included

## Evaluation Criteria

The selection of the Commissioning Consultant will be based on a comprehensive evaluation of the following criteria:

* Technical Merit (e.g., experience, qualifications, and expertise)
* Solution (e.g., innovative and sustainable solutions)
* Price (e.g., cost-effectiveness and competitiveness)

## Security Requirements

* Proponents must provide a duly completed Application for Registration (AFR) form or Initial International Security Screening (IISS) form, as applicable, with their proposal.
* Proponents must hold a valid organization security clearance and have proposed individuals requiring access to classified or protected information, assets, or sensitive work sites meet the security requirement.

## Bid Documents

* Bid documents are available through the Government Electronic Tendering Service at http://Buyandsell.gc.ca/tenders.
* Firms must obtain bid documents from the specified government electronic tendering service to ensure accuracy and completeness.

## Debriefing

* Proposers requesting a debriefing should contact the Contracting Authority within 15 working days of notification of the results of the solicitation.
* Debriefing will include an outline of the strengths and weaknesses of the submission, referring to the evaluation criteria. predug
